item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, August 27, 2024 at 8:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Microsoft donates the Mono Project to the Wine team (328 points | 84 comments)
2. A Collection of Free Public APIs That Is Tested Daily (63 points | 8 comments)
3. Sainsbury Wing contractors find 1990 letter from donor (197 points | 42 comments)
4. DisTrO – a family of low latency distributed optimizers (26 points | 4 comments)
5. Blitzortung – real time lightning strikes around the world (65 points | 16 comments)
6. UltimateAntiCheat (7 points | discuss)
7. Vulnerabilities show why STARTTLS should be avoided if possible (28 points | 6 comments)
8. The Monospace Web (44 points | 5 comments)
9. Grace Hopper on Future Possibilities: Data, Hardware, Software, and People (21 points | 1 comment)
10. Launch HN: Bucket Robotics (YC S24) – Defect detection for molded and cast parts (59 points | 16 comments)
11. Rustproofing Linux (Part 1/4 Leaking Addresses) (2023) (21 points | 1 comment)
12. Great Question (YC W21) Is Hiring Customer Support Lead ( | hide)
13. How Chrome Accessibility Works (3 points | discuss)
14. Box64 and RISC-V in 2024: What It Takes to Run the Witcher 3 on RISC-V (330 points | 122 comments)
15. Malware infiltrates Pidgin messenger's official plugin repository (66 points | 7 comments)
16. NASA's SLS rocket's Mobile Launcher-2 increase from $383M to $2.7B (46 points | 30 comments)
17. Why is the Oral-B iOS app almost 300 MB? And why is Colgate's app even bigger..? (126 points | 104 comments)
18. Your Immune System Is Not a Muscle (33 points | 6 comments)
19. Anthropic publishes the 'system prompts' that make Claude tick (276 points | 173 comments)
20. Splatt3R: Zero-Shot Gaussian Splatting from Uncalibrated Image Pairs (92 points | 20 comments)
21. New 0-Day Attacks Linked to China's 'Volt Typhoon' (164 points | 31 comments)
22. U.S. Ambassador says Canadians are consuming 'unhealthy' amount of American news (75 points | 87 comments)
23. Ruby in Jupyter Notebook (153 points | 51 comments)
24. A New Wave of Underwater Comms Is Coming (23 points | 9 comments)
25. Docker Performance Evaluation Across Operating Systems (19 points | 18 comments)
26. Cerebras launches inference for Llama 3.1; benchmarked at 1846 tokens/s on 8B (62 points | 21 comments)
27. Zuckerberg claims regret on caving to White House pressure on content (328 points | 655 comments)
28. Unlocking the Pixel 9 bootloader breaks some Pixel AI apps (34 points | 9 comments)
29. Language Entropy (8 points | 2 comments)
30. Clay (short for C Layout) is a high performance 2D UI layout library (172 points | 65 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, August 27, 2024 at 8:15 PM UTC
